description: A military conflict fought between the Dzungar Khanate and an alliance of the Qing dynasty and Northern Khalkhas, remnants of the Northern Yuan dynasty.
result: Qing victory, weakening of the Dzungar Khanate, and death of Galdan Boshugtu Khan.

Battle_of_Ulan_Butung.description: Qing forces fail to decisively defeat Dzungar forces despite outnumbering them.

Battle_of_Jao_Modo.description: Qing army decisively defeated the Dzungar army, effectively destroying them as a military force.

war_developments.initial_conflict: Dzungar attack on the Northern Yuan dynasty, leading to their defeat and flight south to the Qing dynasty.
war_developments.Qing_mobilization: Qing sent their army north to subdue the Dzungars motivated by the opportunity to gain control over Mongolia and the threat of a strong, unified Mongol state.
war_developments.tactical_details: Various battles and skirmishes, including the failed attempt by Qing forces to trap and crush the mobile Dzungar army and the eventual decisive defeat of the Dzungars.

post_war_situation.Qing_garrison: Stationed in the area of present-day Ulaanbaatar, placing Khalkha Mongolia under Qing rule.
post_war_situation.Outer_Mongolia_incorporation: Effectively incorporated into the Qing Empire.
post_war_situation.Dzungar_succession: Tsewang Rabtan succeeded Galdan as Khan of the Dzungars.

references.note: Military camp of the Chinese Emperor at Kherlen River during the campaign of 1696
